title: Bryan Lawson
content: Do we really need a simple definition of design or should we accept that design is too complex a matter to be summarized in less than a book?

title: W.A. Dwiggins
content: The first word of the first line is the critical word of that particular body of text. Let it start flush, at least.

title: Aarron Walter
content: If there is one word I’d like to remove from any conversation about design, it’s “pretty.”

title: Albert Einstein
content: If you can’t explain it simply, you don’t understand it well enough.

title: Chris Anderson
content: The enemy of every author is not piracy, but obscurity.

title: Mandy Brown
content: A well-designed text will seem weightless after a time; the initial feel of the book fades away as the mind becomes engrossed in the words.

title: Bill Cosby
content: I don’t know the key to success, but the key to failure is trying to please everybody.

title: Robynne Raye
content: For me, design is like choosing what I’m going to wear for the day – only much more complicated and not really the same at all.

title: Jonathan Ive
content: The word design is everything and nothing. The design and the product itself are inseparable.

title: Albert Einstein
content: Any intelligent fool can make things bigger, more complex, and more violent. It takes a touch of genius – and a lot of courage – to move in the opposite direction.

title: James Goldsmith
content: If you pay peanuts, you get monkeys.
